channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @trekonomics My friends in suburban Tel Aviv would resent that remark.
@acandidworld @levidmorrow I’m Flatto-Sharon. Either get elected to win parliamentary immunity for your crimes, or what’s even the point of being part of the Hewish people?

@trekonomics “Walt Disney put a hall of presidents in his land to assume the mantle of legitimacy. But the redemption will not arrive until Mickey Mouse ears are worn by the Supreme Court sitting in judgement.”

@trekonomics I probably got more of the mythos than you did growing up. And my baseline is always American suburbia; Jerusalem favorably compared to Rochester for urbanity. And in the 80s when I lived there for a couple years, it was cleaner than Manhattan. I understand that has changed.

@trekonomics The interesting thing is that Disney has managed to create a mythos-based pilgrimage that is uniquely non transformative.
@trekonomics Kids visit DC in high school and resolve to run for Congress. Jerusalem and NYC are often life altering events. But Disney attracts like a pilgrimage but never transforms.
@trekonomics Indeed it is. As always, we need a better variety of myth. But what do you expect of the heirs of rabid fundamentalists and greedy slavers?

@trekonomics It’s a chance to visit a place hallowed by myth. In the way my emotions n encountering Jerusalem, D. C., and New York City reflected not just the architecture and commerce, but their respective role in the various mythos in which I was raised.
@trekonomics As someone who was more devoted to the Watergate hearings than to the Mickey Mouse show as a child, I share your disinterest in Disneyland. But for too many, it provides a rare brush with transcendence.
@trekonomics You should at least read the relevant page or two in Doctorow’s Book of Daniel.
@arielbeery Oy.
@MetsYeet @gideondabi @DougJBalloon That’s the kind of sensible perspective the Algorithm was designed to obliterate. Sorry.
@elierosenfeld Be bold! Cross state lines!

@drvolts I suspect that it’s as banal as ends justify the means + a steady diet of misinformation. She probably sincerely believes she’s saving America from forced gay collective farming and miscegenation.
If I was spending money advertising public health messages to Yiddish speakers on Twitter, I’d probably splurge for a more hassidische looking spokesmodel. https://t.co/pkTxGGf0eV
@jacobkornbluh Can you target Yiddish speakers for your twitter ad campaigns?
@elierosenfeld: You might want to pitch NYC on culturally competent social media marketing that goes beyond Yiddish translation. https://t.co/pkTxGGf0eV
@typolad The problem is they have less power than a new $50 Amazon tablet, and will require more than $50 in time to support.
@HannahLebovits So are you going to sacrifice one of his toys each day, or one the first, two the second, etc.?
@MisfitTorah Finally, your chance to thank the Academy!
@trekonomics Meanwhile in NJ, it hasn’t snowed since yesterday.
@kampeas I wonder if anyone shared the Yehudim Baim skits about Ben Gurion at Sde Boker making crank phone calls to Levi Eshkol with the visiting dignitaries.
@JWiley8974 @garethlpowell @scalzi More worried about what 2023 might do with kittens.
Three cool planets and a pioneer microcomputer kit. https://t.co/0PhNylXFFx
@unidentifedbird To fulfill what was written, “Don’t stop thinking about tomorrow.”
Worth noting that Christian-linked extremists have been promoting this sort of terrorism for some time now. https://t.co/sVPovnxqYV
@wcrichton Forwarded to a possibly interested party.
